sen.j: 藤原清河（ふじわら の きよかわ、慶雲3年（706年）- 宝亀9年（778年））は奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kiyokawa (706 - 778) was one of the nobility during the Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Kiyokawa (706 - 778) was one of the nobility during the Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Kiyokawa (706 - 778) was one of the nobility during the Nara Period.

sen.j: 藤原房前の第四子。
sen.e: He was the 4th child of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He was the 4th child of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He was the 4th child of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.

sen.j: 唐名は河清。
sen.e: His Tang name was Kasei.
sen.cmt: 河清を中国語読みする必要がありますか？Heqingでしょうか。（『新字源』（角川書店））
sen.e: His Tang name was Kasei.
His Tang name was Kasei.

sen.j: 従三位、参議。
sen.e: He was in the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and in the position of Sangi (councilor).
He was in the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and in the position of Sangi (councilor).
He was in the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and in the position of Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 贈従一位。
sen.e: He received postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
He received a postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
He received a postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 遣唐使として入唐し、阿倍仲麻呂と唐に仕えるも、暴風や安史の乱により日本への帰国は叶わず、在唐のまま没した。
sen.e: He visited China as Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) and served the Tang Dynasty with ABE no Nakamaro, but he could not return to Japan due to a storm and the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming until the end of his life.
sen.cmt: 安史の乱：the rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming （研究社和英大辞典）, Revolt of General An Lushan （グランドコンサイス和英辞典）
sen.e: He visited China as Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) and served the Tang Dynasty with ABE no Nakamaro, but he could not return to Japan due to a storm and the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming until the end of his life.

He visited China as Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) and served the Tang Dynasty with ABE no Nakamaro, but he could not return to Japan due to a storm and the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming until the end of his life.

sen.j: 天平勝宝2年（750年）9月、清河は遣唐大使に任じられる。
sen.e: In September, 750, Kiyokawa was appointed to Kento-taishi (commander-in-chief of the Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).
In September, 750, Kiyokawa was appointed as Kento-taishi (commander-in-chief of the Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).
In September, 750, Kiyokawa was appointed as Kento-taishi (commander-in-chief of the Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China).

sen.j: 副使には大伴古麻呂と吉備真備が任じられた。
sen.e: As vice-commanders, OTOMO no Komaro and KIBI no Makibi were appointed.
As vice-commanders, OTOMO no Komaro and KIBI no Makibi were appointed.
As vice-commanders, OTOMO no Komaro and KIBI no Makibi were appointed.

sen.j: 天平勝宝4年（752年）閏3月、出発にあたり清河は節刀を拝し、正四位下に叙される。
sen.e: In intercalary March of the year 752, before the departure, Kiyokawa received a sword representing his full authority, and was given the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In intercalary March of the year 752, before the departure, Kiyokawa received a sword representing his full authority, and was given the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In intercalary March of the year 752, before the departure, Kiyokawa received a sword representing his full authority, and was given the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 遣唐使一行は唐に到着して長安に入り、玄宗 (唐)に謁し、君子人なりと称賛された。
sen.e: The party of Kento-shi reached Tang and went into the city of Changan, and he had an audience with Xuan Zong, the Tang Emperor, and was praised as a man of virtue.
sen.cmt: 長安：Changan （研究社和英大辞典）玄宗：Hsuan Tsung, or Xuan Zong（ピンイン） （研究社和英大辞典）
sen.e: The party of Kento-shi reached Tang and went into the city of Changan, and he had an audience with Xuan Zong, the Tang Emperor, and was praised as a man of virtue.
The party of Kento-shi reached Tang and went into the city of Changan, and he had an audience with Xuan Zong, the Tang Emperor, and was praised as a man of virtue.

sen.j: 天平勝宝5年（753年）1月、諸藩の朝賀に出席。
sen.e: In January, 753, he attended the meeting of New Year's salutation from the surrounding countries to the Chinese Emperor.
In January, 753, he attended the meeting of New Year's salutation from the surrounding countries to the Chinese Emperor.
In January, 753, he attended the meeting of New Year's salutation from the surrounding countries to the Chinese Emperor.

sen.j: 日本の席次が西畔（西側）第二席で吐蕃王朝の次であるのに対して、新羅が東畔第一席で日本より上席であったことに抗議し、新羅と席を交代させ、日本の面目を守っている。
sen.e: He made a protest about Japan's seat being the second after the Tibetan Empire on the west side, although Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) was the first on the east side, which meant Shiragi's precedence over Japan, so he forced to exchange the position with Shiragi so that he could preserve Japan's honor.

He made a protest about Japan's seat being the second after the Tibetan Empire on the west side, although Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) was the first on the east side, which meant Shiragi's precedence over Japan, so he forced to exchange the position with Shiragi so that he could preserve Japan's honor.

He made a protest about Japan's seat being the second after the Tibetan Empire on the west side, although Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) was the first on the east side, which meant Shiragi's precedence over Japan, so he forced to exchange the position with Shiragi so that he could preserve Japan's honor.

sen.j: 同年12月、清河ら遣唐使一行は、在唐35年におよび唐の高官にもなっていた阿倍仲麻呂を伴い帰国の途につく。
sen.e: In December, 753, Kiyokawa and the party of Kento-shi were coming back to Japan together with ABE no Nakamaro, who had stayed in Tang for 35 years as a senior official.
In December, 753, Kiyokawa and the party of Kento-shi were coming back to Japan together with ABE no Nakamaro, who had stayed in Tang for 35 years as a senior official.
In December, 753, Kiyokawa and the party of Kento-shi were coming back to Japan together with ABE no Nakamaro, who had stayed in Tang for 35 years as a senior official.

sen.j: 日本への渡航を望む鑑真一行が乗船を希望したが、唐が鑑真の出国を禁じたため清河は乗船を拒否した。
sen.e: The party of Ganjin (Jianzhen), who wanted a missionary travel to Japan, wished to board, but Tang prohibited Ganjin from leaving the country, so Kiyokawa rejected his boarding.
The party of Ganjin (Jianzhen), who wanted a missionary to travel to Japan, wished to board, but Tang prohibited Ganjin from leaving the country, so Kiyokawa rejected his boarding.
The party of Ganjin (Jianzhen), who wanted a missionary to travel to Japan, wished to board, but Tang prohibited Ganjin from leaving the country, so Kiyokawa rejected his boarding.

sen.j: しかし、副使の大伴古麻呂が独断で鑑真を自身の船に乗せた。
sen.e: However, OTOMO no Komaro, vice-commander, boarded Ganjin on his ship at his own decision.
However, OTOMO no Komaro, vice-commander, boarded Ganjin on his ship at his own decision.
However, OTOMO no Komaro, vice-commander, boarded Ganjin on his ship at his own decision.

sen.j: 遣唐船は楊州を出航したが、清河と仲麻呂の乗る第一船は逆風に遭い唐南方の驩州（かんしゅう）（ベトナム）に漂着。
sen.e: The Japanese envoy ships left the city of Yangzhou, but the first ship that Kiyokawa and Nakamaro boarded was caught in a head wind and was drifted to the city of Huanzhou in the south of Tang (present-day Vietnam).

The Japanese envoy ships left the city of Yangzhou, but the first ship that Kiyokawa and Nakamaro boarded was caught in a head wind and was drifted to the city of Huanzhou in the south of Tang (present-day Vietnam).

The Japanese envoy ships left the city of Yangzhou, but the first ship that Kiyokawa and Nakamaro boarded was caught in a head wind and was drifted to the city of Huanzhou in the south of Tang (present-day Vietnam).

sen.j: （井上靖の『天平の甍』では沖縄までは来たが出航時に座礁。
sen.e: (In "Tempyo no Iraka" [The Roof Tile of Tempyo], a novel written by Yasushi INOUE, the ship came down to Okinawa, but was stranded when sailing out.
sen.cmt: 『天平の甍』"The Roof Tile of Tempyo"（Amazon）
sen.e: (In "Tempyo no Iraka" [The Roof Tile of Tempyo], a novel written by Yasushi INOUE, the ship came down to Okinawa, but was stranded when sailing out.
(In "Tempyo no Iraka" [The Roof Tile of Tempyo], a novel written by Yasushi INOUE, the ship came down to Okinawa, but was stranded when sailing out.

sen.j: その後遭難して安南に漂着したとある）。
sen.e: Then, it went wrecked and was drifted to Annam.)
Then, it went wrecked and was drifted to Annam.)
Then, it went wrecked and was drifted to Annam.)

sen.j: 土人に襲われ、船員の多くが害され、清河と仲麻呂は僅に身をもって免がれた。
sen.e: They were assailed by the natives and many of the crew were killed, but Kiyokawa and Nakamaro had a narrow escape.
They were assailed by the natives and many of the crew were killed, but Kiyokawa and Nakamaro had a narrow escape.
They were assailed by the natives and many of the crew were killed, but Kiyokawa and Nakamaro had a narrow escape.

sen.j: 一方、鑑真を乗せた第二船は無事日本へ帰国した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the second ship that Ganjin boarded returned to Japan safely.
Meanwhile, the second ship that Ganjin boarded returned to Japan safely.
Meanwhile, the second ship that Ganjin boarded returned to Japan safely.

sen.j: 天平勝宝7歳（755年）清河と仲麻呂に長安に帰着。
sen.e: In 755, Kiyokawa and Nakamaro returned to Changan.
In 755, Kiyokawa and Nakamaro returned to Changan.
In 755, Kiyokawa and Nakamaro returned to Changan.

sen.j: 清河は河清と名を改めて唐朝に出仕することになり、秘書監になった。
sen.e: Kiyokawa renamed himself Kasei to attend at the Tang Dynasty court and was appointed to secretary.
sen.cmt: 河清を中国語読みする必要がありますか？Heqingでしょうか。（『新字源』（角川書店））
sen.e: Kiyokawa renamed himself Kasei to attend at the Tang Dynasty court and was appointed as secretary.
Kiyokawa renamed himself Kasei to attend at the Tang Dynasty court and was appointed as secretary.

sen.j: 天平宝字3年（759年）清河を迎えるため高元度を大使とする迎入唐使が渤海国経由で入唐した。
sen.e: In 759, an envoy for welcoming the envoy visiting Tang, which was lead by taishi (commander-in-chief) Kogendo, reached Tang via the country of Bo Hai.
In 759, an envoy for welcoming the envoy visiting Tang, which was lead by taishi (commander-in-chief) Kogendo, reached Tang via the country of Bo Hai.
In 759, an envoy for welcoming the envoy visiting Tang, which was lead by taishi (commander-in-chief) Kogendo, reached Tang via the country of Bo Hai.

sen.j: しかし、当時は安史の乱により唐は騒乱状態であったため、行路の危険を理由に唐朝は清河の帰国を許さなかった。
sen.e: However, the Tang Dynasty did not allow Kiyokawa to return home on the grounds that the travel would be dangerous due to Tang's turbulence by the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming.
However, the Tang Dynasty did not allow Kiyokawa to return home on the grounds that the travel would be dangerous due to Tang's turbulence by the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming.
However, the Tang Dynasty did not allow Kiyokawa to return home on the grounds that the travel would be dangerous due to Tang's turbulence by the Rebellion of An Lu-shan and Shih Ssu-ming.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年）日本では清河を在唐大使のまま常陸国守に任じ、天平宝字8年（764年）従三位に進ませる。
sen.e: In 763 in Japan, Kiyokawa was appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province), remaining at commander-in-chief of the envoy to Tang, and in 764 he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

In 763 in Japan, Kiyokawa was appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province), remaining at commander-in-chief of the envoy to Tang, and in 764 he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

In 763 in Japan, Kiyokawa was appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province), remaining at commander-in-chief of the envoy to Tang, and in 764 he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 清河は帰国できないまま在唐十余年に及び、宝亀8年（777年）次回の遣唐使が入唐したが、翌年、清河は唐で客死した。
sen.e: Kiyokawa's stay in Tang amounted to more than ten years without a chance to return to Japan, and in 777 the next Kento-shi reached Tang, but in 778 Kiyokawa died in Tang.
Kiyokawa's stay in Tang amounted to more than ten years without a chance to return to Japan, and in 777 the next Kento-shi reached Tang, but in 778 Kiyokawa died in Tang.
Kiyokawa's stay in Tang amounted to more than ten years without a chance to return to Japan, and in 777 the next Kento-shi reached Tang, but in 778 Kiyokawa died in Tang.

sen.j: 唐からは路州大都督の官が贈られた。
sen.e: He received from Tang the rank of grand governor general of Luzhou.
sen.cmt: 路州は潞州だと思います。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%95%B7%E6%B2%BB%E5%B8%82『世界史地図』（吉川弘文館）潞州："lu""zhou"（『中日辞典』（小学館））
sen.e: He received from Tang the rank of grand governor general of Luzhou.
He received from Tang the rank of grand governor general of Luzhou.

sen.j: 清河は唐の婦人と結婚して、喜娘という娘をもうけていた。
sen.e: Kiyokawa married a woman from Tang and had a daughter named Kijo.
Kiyokawa married a woman from Tang and had a daughter named Kijo.
Kiyokawa married a woman from Tang and had a daughter named Kijo.

sen.j: 喜娘は宝亀の遣唐使に伴われて来日した。
sen.e: Kijo came to Japan with Kento-shi during the Hoki era.
Kijo came to Japan with Kento-shi during the Hoki era.
Kijo came to Japan with Kento-shi during the Hoki era.

sen.j: 宝亀10年（779年）贈従二位。
sen.e: In 779, he received postmortem promotion to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
In 779, he received postmortem promotion to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
In 779, he received postmortem promotion to Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 承和 (日本)3年（836年）贈従一位。
sen.e: In 836, he received postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 836, he received postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 836, he received postmortem promotion to Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 天平12年 （740年） 従五位下
sen.e: In 740, he received the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 740, he received the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 740, he received the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 天平13年 （741年） 中務少輔
sen.e: In 741, he was appointed to Nakatsukasa no Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Imperial Household Ministry).
In 741, he was appointed to Nakatsukasa no Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Imperial Household Ministry).
In 741, he was appointed to Nakatsukasa no Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Imperial Household Ministry).

sen.j: 天平15年 （743年） 正五位下、大和国国司
sen.e: In 743, he received the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was appointed to Yamato no kuni Kokushi (governor of Yamato province).
In 743, he received the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was appointed to Yamato no kuni Kokushi (governor of Yamato province).
In 743, he received the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and was appointed to Yamato no kuni Kokushi (governor of Yamato province).

sen.j: 天平17年 （745年） 正五位上
sen.e: In 745, he received the rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
In 745, he received the rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
In 745, he received the rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 天平18年 （746年） 従四位下
sen.e: In 746, he received the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 746, he received the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 746, he received the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 天平勝宝元年 （749年） 参議
sen.e: In 749, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).
In 749, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).
In 749, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 天平勝宝4年（752年）正四位下、遣唐大使、民部卿
sen.e: In 752, he received the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), and was appointed to the commander-in-chief of the Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China and also appointed to Minbukyo (Minister of the Finance and Tax Ministry).

In 752, he received the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), and was appointed as the commander-in-chief of the Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China and also appointed to Minbukyo (Minister of the Finance and Tax Ministry).

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年）兼常陸守
sen.e: In 763, he was concurrently appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province).
In 763, he was concurrently appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province).
In 763, he was concurrently appointed to Hitachi no Kami (governor of Hitachi Province).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）従三位
sen.e: In 764, he received the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
In 764, he received the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
